item.title: A. add a quote by Thomas A. Edison
item.description: "Negative results are just what I want. They’re just as valuable to me as positive results. I can never find the thing that does the job best until I find the ones that don’t." -- Thomas A. Edison

item.title: A. add a quote by Thomas A. Edison
item.description: "Genius is one percent inspiration, ninety-nine percent perspiration." -- Thomas A. Edison

item.title: A. add a quote by Thomas A. Edison
item.description: "Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up." -- Thomas A. Edison

item.title: A. add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I do not want people to be very agreeable, as it saves me the trouble of liking them a great deal." -- Jane Austen

item.title: A. add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: A. add a quote by Sydney J. Harris
item.description: "The time to relax is when you don't have time for it." -- Sydney J. Harris

item.title: A. add a quote by Laurence J. Peter
item.description: "You don't need to take a persons advice to make him feel good, just ask him for it." -- Laurence J. Peter

item.title: A. add a quote by Laura Schlessinger
item.description: "The TEN Commandments are not prefaced with "If you're in the mood"." -- Laura Schlessinger

item.title: A. add a quote by Michael First
item.description: "Live your life the way you Want Your kids to live theirs." -- Michael First

item.title: A. add a quote by Arnold H. Glasow
item.description: "Live so your Friends can defend you, But never have to." -- Arnold H. Glasow

item.title: A. add a quote by Barbra Streisand
item.description: "Why does a woman work ten years to change a man, then complain he's not the man she married?" -- Barbra Streisand

item.title: A. add a quote by Kitty O'Neil
item.description: "What I'm looking for is a Blessing NOT in disguise!" -- Kitty O'Neil

item.title: A. add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "To have a right to do a thing is not at all the same as to be right in doing it." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: A. add a quote by John Wooden
item.description: "Do not let what you cannot do interfere with what you can do." -- John Wooden

item.title: A. add a quote by Dave Weinbaum
item.description: "Being truthful when you know it will cost you , Is the true test of honesty." -- Dave Weinbaum

item.title: A. add a quote by Mike Murdock
item.description: "You will only be remembered for two things: the problems you solve, or the ones you create." -- Mike Murdock

item.title: A. add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: A. add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Never tell the truth to people who are not worthy of it." -- Mark Twain

item.title: A. add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: A. add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Love is a better master than duty." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: A. add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Keep your face to the sun and you will never see the shadows." -- Helen Keller

item.title: A. add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched. They must be felt with the heart" -- Helen Keller

item.title: A. add a quote by Edward Everett Hale
item.description: "I am only one, but still I am one. I cannot do everything, but still I can do something; and because I cannot do everything, I will not refuse to do something that I can do." -- Edward Everett Hale

item.title: A. add a quote by H. Jackson Brown Jr.
item.description: "Don't say you don't have enough time. You have exactly the same number of hours per day that were given to Helen Keller, Pasteur, Michaelangelo, Mother Teresa, Leonardo da Vinci, Thomas Jefferson, and Albert Einstein." -- H. Jackson Brown Jr.

item.title: A. add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "Far away there in the sunshine are my highest aspirations. I may not reach them, but I can look up and see their beauty, believe in them, and try to follow where they lead." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: A. add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, vision cleared, ambition inspired, and success achieved." -- Helen Keller

item.title: A. add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: A. add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "I ask not for any crown But that which all may win; Nor try to conquer any world Except the one within." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: A. add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "I am not afraid of storms, for I am learning how to sail my ship." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: A. add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "If we are all alive ten years hence, let's meet, and see how many of us have got our wishes, or how much nearer we are then than now." -- Louisa May Alcott
